meanings.definition: A substance used to make something black or shiny.
meanings.sent1: I applied the blacking to my shoes to make them shiny.
meanings.sent2: The blacking on the car's tires made them look brand new.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat left paw prints in the blacking, trying to be an artist.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like blacking, spreading joy wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The blacking transformed the dull surface into a glossy masterpiece.

meanings.definition: The act of making something black or shiny.
meanings.sent1: His job at the factory involved applying blacking to metal parts.
meanings.sent2: The blacking of the leather jacket gave it a sleek appearance.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand turned everything it touched into blacking, much to the audience's surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like blacking, adding depth and richness to the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The blacking process required precision and attention to detail.

meanings.definition: The process of covering up or concealing something.
meanings.sent1: The blacking of the truth only led to more confusion.
meanings.sent2: She used blacking to hide the imperfections on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a clue hidden under layers of blacking, revealing the mystery.
meanings.sent4: His smile was a mask of blacking, hiding his true emotions.
meanings.sent5: The blacking of the scandal was unsuccessful as the truth eventually came out.
